TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract VersionUpgradeEvent implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.DocEvent, class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.DocReturnEvent
type VersionUpgradeEvent = interface interface DocReturnEvent interface DocEvent

Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DocumentVersion As String
public: property System::String ^ DocumentVersion { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the version number of a Microsoft InfoPath form.

remarks.para: This property can be used only during the event.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

example.para: In the following example, the DocumentVersion property of the object is used to display the version number of an InfoPath form in a message box:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ReturnStatus { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ReturnStatus : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the return status of the event.

remarks.para: If the ReturnStatus property is set to false, the OnVersionUpgrade event fails and the form is not opened. If set to true, the OnVersionUpgrade event is successful.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

example.para: In the following example, the ReturnStatus property of the object is used to indicate that the event was not successful:
